intro: Attacking top-order batter

Reliable gloveman

name: Jonny Bairstow
intro: Highly experienced as an opener and in the middle-order
Keeps wickets and can contribute as a fielder
Attacks spinners from the get-go

name: Yashasvi Jaiswal
intro: Highly-talented attacking left-handed opener
Player of the Series - 2020 U-19 World Cup

name: Devdutt Padikkal
intro: Consistent at the top of the order
Strong off the back-foot and a wristy player
Safe outfielder and catcher

name: Shimron Hetmyer
intro: An aggressive middle-order batter
Equally lethal against spin and pace
Capable of batting in different gears

name: Joe Root
intro: A canny batter against all kinds of spin
Can be very useful as an anchor in the top-order
Bowls useful off-breaks and is a safe catcher

name: Kuldip Yadav
intro: Tall, left-arm, skiddy pacer
Can move the ball both ways

name: Navdeep Saini
intro: Hit-the-deck kind of bowler
Has raw pace that can surprise the batters
Still developing as death overs bowler

name: Kuldeep Sen
intro: Lanky right-arm pacer who can hit the deck hard
Swings the ball both ways
Has a very good inswinging yorker

name: Obed McCoy
intro: Swings the new ball at high pace
Possesses an extremely deceptive slower ball
Offers good value as a death bowler due to his effective pace variations

name: KC Cariappa
intro: Mystery spinner
Is coming off a good first-class season
Can be handy on slow Indian tracks

name: Yuzvendra Chahal
intro: Brave spinner who flights the ball
Gets good turn on both leg-spin/googly
Always on the list for the Purple Cap

name: Prasidh Krishna
intro: Can extract extra bounce and bowls at high pace
Has good mix of variations
Experience of playing for the national side

name: Trent Boult
intro: Can bowl at any stage of the game
Swings the new ball, has many slower ball variations
Brilliant boundary fielder

name: Adam Zampa
intro: Australia's most-trusted white-ball spinner in the last 5 years
Has a superb leg-break and uses the wrong 'un effectively
Often used as a middle-overs enforcer

name: KM Asif
intro: Right-arm pacer from Kerala
Part of IPL winning squad (CSK) in 2018 and 2021
Best of 3/15 in T20s

name: Murugan Ashwin
intro: Turns the ball sharply
Genuine wicket-taker
Utility option with the bat

name: Riyan Parag
intro: Lower-order power hitter
Useful off-spinner and a top-class fielder
Gives good balance to any side

name: Ravichandran Ashwin
intro: Off-spinner who has lots of varieties
Can also bowl leg spin if needed
Capable with the bat, can produce cameos

name: Jason Holder
intro: Arguably one of the best fast-bowling all-rounder currently
Can be a leadership candidate
Extracts good bounce with his height

name: Abdul Basith
intro: Aggressive batting all-rounder from Kerala
Bowls right arm off-break
Usually bats in the middle-order

name: Sanju Samson
intro: Plays outstanding shots
Can operate smoothly in all gears
Match-winner, prolific run-getter

name: Jos Buttler
intro: One of the hardest hitters the game has seen
Top wicket-keeper
Intimidating batter who can open and finish games

name: Dhruv Jurel
intro: Exciting middle-order hitter who has a good range of shots
Vice-captain of the Indian team at 2020 U-19 World Cup

name: Donavon Ferreira
intro: Powerful middle-order bat
Wicket-keeper and can bowl as well
Plays for Titans in CSA T20 challenge

name: Kunal Singh Rathore
intro: Left-handed wicket-keeper batter
Usually bats in the top 4
Favours the leg-side

name: Aiden Markram
intro: Technically sound top-order batsman
A proven customer on sub-continental tracks
Useful off-spinner who can sneak in a couple of overs in the powerplay

name: Rahul Tripathi
intro: Proven opener and finisher in IPL
Plays percentage cricket if and when needed
Innovative stroke-maker

name: Mayank Agarwal
intro: A steady base and a superb driver through the off-side
Loves pace on the ball and excellent against spin
Experience of captaincy in IPL

name: Harry Brook
intro: An aggressive batter
Scores at a rapid pace and is good against spin
Player of the series in both T20 & Test series in Pakistan 2022

name: Anmolpreet Singh
intro: Highly experienced in domestic circuit
Builds partnership at the top of the order
Can absorb pressure situations

name: Umran Malik
intro: Tearaway right-arm speedster
Can bowl 150+ and move the ball at pace as well

name: Fazalhaq Farooqi
intro: Left-arm pacer, who bowls a good slower ball
Was a net bowler with CSK for IPL 2021

name: Kartik Tyagi
intro: Can crank up the speedguns
Gets the new ball to move around
Extremely accurate with his yorkers at the death

name: T Natarajan
intro: Yorker specialist
Excellent record while bowling in the death
Has ample variations to keep the batsmen guessing

name: Bhuvneshwar Kumar
intro: Experienced to bowl with new and old ball
Possesses good variations
Has a deadly inswinger

name: Akeal Hosein
intro: Is very accurate with his left-arm slow orthodox
Bowls mainly during the powerplay
Competent with the bat as a lower-order hitter

name: Mayank Markande
intro: Good upcoming Indian leggie
Has a well-disguised googly
Had a superb season with MI in 2018

name: Adil Rashid
intro: One of the best spinners going around in world cricket at the moment
Bowled a wicket-maiden in 2022 T20 WC final
Can be handy with the bat

name: Abdul Samad
intro: Powerful striker
Can clear any boundary with ease
Useful with his leg-breaks

name: Marco Jansen
intro: Left arm swing bowler, extracts extra bounce
Experience of playing in pressure situations (Test cricket)
More than handy with the bat

name: Abhishek Sharma
intro: Utility cricketer, contributing with bat, ball and in the field
Can bat in different positions
Loves targetting the spinners

name: Washington Sundar
intro: A batting all-rounder
Mainly utilized for his powerplay bowling skills
Can float around in the batting order

name: Mayank Dagar
intro: Recorded best bowling figures in the U-19 WC final 2016
Bowls left-arm orthodox spin
Very handy with the bat

name: Vivrant Sharma
intro: Stylish and elegant left-handed batter
Loves playing in the V
Can bowl googlies

name: Sanvir Singh
intro: Right-handed batting all-rounder from Punjab
Plays finisher role with the bat
USeful pacer with ability to swing

name: Samarth Vyas
intro: A natural striker of the ball
Very good against any kind of spin and deft against pace
Has an impressive SR of 150 in T20s

name: Glenn Phillips
intro: Big-hitter and bowls handy off-spin
Keeps wickets and is a gun outfielder
Has hit most sixes in T20s in 2021

name: Heinrich Klaasen
intro: An aggressive batter who loves the finisher role
Very handy wicket-keeper and a safe fielder as well
Hit 105 sixes and 175 fours so far in T20s

name: Nitish Reddy
intro: Promising all-rounder from Andhra
Batting style similar to Manish Pandey
Bowls handy right-arm medium pace

name: Upendra Yadav
intro: Top-order keeper-bat from UP
Relies on timing with the bat
Can bowl off spin
